page.title: 17 SPEEDWAY STADIUM - WEST ROW
page.content: THE SPEEDWAY STADIUM AT WEST ROW IS THE HOME OF THE MILDENHALL FEN TIGERS, WHO COMPETE IN THE NATIONAL LEAGUE. WITH GATES OF AROUND 1500, FEN TIGERS HAVE STEADY LOCAL SUPPORT.THEIR FINEST HOUR WAS IN 1979 WHEN THEY WON THE LEAGUE. THEIR BIGGEST GATE WAS IN THE SAME YEAR - 10,000 - WHEN THEY ENTERTAINED RYE HOUSE. THE SPEEDWAY EVOLVED FROM HUMBLE BEGINNINGS 13 YEARS AGO. A GROUP OF ENTHUSIASTS, AIDED BY THE SYMPATHETIC FARMER, TURNED A FIELD INTO A TRACK BY LAYING A CHALK FOUNDATION. GRADUALLY OVER THE YEARS, THE BANKING WAS BUILT UP AND BARS, CHANGING-ROOMS, STANDS, OFFICES, AND A CHILDREN'S PLAY AREA WERE ADDED. NOW THE STADIUM ALSO CATERS FOR STOCK CAR RACING, AND SOCIAL FUNCTIONS OF ALL KINDS ARE HELD IN THE BALLROOM.
